CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lucille Freeman, parttime worker, 2208 LaPlace Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "If there had been fair and all out prosecution, there would be more progress. But still here in Pittsburgh, there are many places where colored people cannot be served."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lucille Freeman, wearing flecked dress with looped trim, dark coat with light colored trim, and tam, standing in front of painted brick wall
